list_definition.definition: a formal meeting and discussion with someone, eg a person applying for a job, or a person with information to broadcast on radio or television

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I always get nervous before job interviews
The author gave a fascinating radio interview last month.

list_definition.definition: to question (a person) in an interview

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They interviewed seven people for the job
He was interviewed by reporters about his policies.

list_ex_of_english: Candidates are showing up in a random order for the interview.
Both authors advocate an eclectic mix of quantitative survey and qualitative interviews for the study of current rural labour transformations.
At one point they interview a soldier recovering from amnesia.
Although recruits were informed of the purpose of the interview, they were not provided with a copy of the interview schedule in advance.
The interviewees were not known beforehand by the interviewers, and the interviews took place at the interviewees' institutions.
Each interview took about 5 min to complete.
How can you interview the patient in teaching rounds with compassion and so as to avoid disrespect?
Fifty-two participants (53 %) returned the questionnaire on interview preference.
